snippet.textDisplay:
From what I recall, the "language" used in the game soundtracks isn't a real language at all. The composers thought to make a soundtrack that truly focused on vocal performance, and eliminated the concept of trying to understand the lyrics from the equation. From what I recall, the pseudo-language is composed of Japanese, English, German, French. 

Basically, you don't need to think about what you're listening to at all. Just listen to the music ;)
snippet.textOriginal:
From what I recall, the "language" used in the game soundtracks isn't a real language at all. The composers thought to make a soundtrack that truly focused on vocal performance, and eliminated the concept of trying to understand the lyrics from the equation. From what I recall, the pseudo-language is composed of Japanese, English, German, French. 

Basically, you don't need to think about what you're listening to at all. Just listen to the music ;)

snippet.textDisplay: I remember when I got this game for 12$ at a nearby GameStop. The guy who sold it to me thought I was crazy for buying it - it wasn't reviewed too well but FUCK them; The storyline and OST are amazing! Good characters, funny dialogue, REAL emotion? If you can ever find this game try it.

snippet.textDisplay:
To the people who did not like this part of the game at Facade I say this:

At first I thought them to be creative nuisances but then I remembered what Fyra had said when she asked about the rules of Facade to the King. She was told, "rules do not exist to bind you, they exist so you may know your freedoms" When you apply that logic to that dungeon, everything makes sense and you will have a greater appreciate for it. 

The realization is mind blowing. Truly my favorite part of the game.
snippet.textOriginal:

The realization is mind blowing. Truly my favorite part of the game.

snippet.textDisplay:
This post made me finally rent NieR, even after reading the mediocre reviews. My expectations were low, but man...was I ever blow away.

Sure, their is a lot of fetch quests...but NieR is aesthetically delightful. I dove head-first into the story, and find myself bobbing and weaving in an almost melancholic manner to the music.

NieR is one of my favorite games, and I hope it gets a sequel. Perhaps if they please the critics with better game mechanics, it'll get the credit it deserves.
snippet.textOriginal:
This post made me finally rent NieR, even after reading the mediocre reviews. My expectations were low, but man...was I ever blow away.

Sure, their is a lot of fetch quests...but NieR is aesthetically delightful. I dove head-first into the story, and find myself bobbing and weaving in an almost melancholic manner to the music.

NieR is one of my favorite games, and I hope it gets a sequel. Perhaps if they please the critics with better game mechanics, it'll get the credit it deserves.

snippet.textDisplay: Reviewers generally don't know jack and rate games based on how much new stuff they do and the technical aspects. Example, many people have turned up disappointed with latest CoD, yet reviewers still seem to give it 9/10-10/10. 3D Dot Game Heroes reviewers said was about a 7/10, when it was definitely closer to a 8.5-9/10 according to players(including myself). Only time to notice reviews is when EVERY reviewer says a game is a 3/10 or lower.
snippet.textOriginal: Reviewers generally don't know jack and rate games based on how much new stuff they do and the technical aspects. Example, many people have turned up disappointed with latest CoD, yet reviewers still seem to give it 9/10-10/10. 3D Dot Game Heroes reviewers said was about a 7/10, when it was definitely closer to a 8.5-9/10 according to players(including myself). Only time to notice reviews is when EVERY reviewer says a game is a 3/10 or lower.

snippet.textDisplay: I really enjoyed this game. It actually had great characters and an interesting(if a little strange) story. The music really stood out though.
